discussion.author: thery
discussion.comment: @palmskog Thanks

discussion.author: palmskog
discussion.comment: @thery there are a few deprecations left, but I don't have time to fix them. So if this looks OK, maybe we can merge?

discussion.author: thery
discussion.comment: @palmskog   ok I have removed the other warnings. Thanks for the PR!

discussion.author: palmskog
discussion.comment: @Zimmi48 unfortunately, I don't think we can use the description of the "project" in the description of the opam file. This is because the opam file does not build or install the actual implementation of Knuth's algorithm (which is encoded in Why3). In other words, it's one of those cases where our templates can't fully handle a complex situation.

discussion.author: Zimmi48
discussion.comment:
OK, though in this case, the description was already used in the opam file, and there was just a minor discrepancy between the two files.

Feel free to amend this PR in any way you find suitable.

discussion.author: Zimmi48
discussion.comment: BTW, it seems to me that such edge cases are actually more and more common (especially as we go toward more monorepos) so we should have a discussion on how we plan to support those.

discussion.author: palmskog
discussion.comment: @thery any reservations, or can I merge this?

discussion.author: thery
discussion.comment:
yes you can merge.
Ps : you have been smarter than I am. I could not make it why3 replay work without the library being installed.

discussion.author: palmskog
discussion.comment: In fact I did not solve the issue with replay only working with the library installed (I suspect one has to pass some configuration option to `why3` which then passes it to `coqc`). However, with a separate opam package for the replay, the assumption is anyway that all Coq files are installed.

discussion.author: thery
discussion.comment: Let's see what the why3 expect think : [518](https://gitlab.inria.fr/why3/why3/-/issues/518)

discussion.author: thery
discussion.comment: There is a work around but maybe your solution is better [518](https://gitlab.inria.fr/why3/why3/-/issues/518)

discussion.author: palmskog
discussion.comment: How about we document both options - running with installed Bertrand proof and local Bertrand proof? I still think the installed option is to be preferred in continuous integration, though, to avoid having to fiddle with Why3 configuration files inside the Docker container.

discussion.author: thery
discussion.comment: Let's wait they close the issue ;-)

discussion.author: thery
discussion.comment: @palmskog I've updated the `Knuth.mlw`, it works with current version of `why3`. Having a VST version of it would be great. When there is a new full lockdown I may have a go at it :wink:

discussion.author: Zimmi48
discussion.comment: @palmskog has just been put as a default maintainer in the opam files by the template generation process. You can override this and put yourself by setting the `opam-file-maintainer` variable in the `meta.yml` file. In any case, feel free to publish the new versions on opam of this package (of which you are indeed the maintainer) and of any other package in fact (the good thing about the publishing process being via a git repository is that it is easy to collaborate on publishing packages, and it doesn't need to be always the maintainer who does it). I am not sure what difference it makes to copy the opam file from here or from the previous versions in the opam archive.

discussion.author: Zimmi48
discussion.comment:
As shown in the previous build (https://travis-ci.com/coq-community/bertrand/builds/95448632), the code is not yet compatible with Coq 8.9-8.10:

```
File "./Partition.v", line 32, characters 4-5:
Error:
Syntax error: [prim:ident] expected after 'fix' (in [tactic:simple_tactic]).
```

discussion.author: Zimmi48
discussion.comment: @herbelin ping

discussion.author: Zimmi48
discussion.comment: I'm assuming that the comment in coq-community/stalmarck#4 applies here as well. However, note that this PR only tests compatibility with 8.8 because bertrand is not yet compatible with newer Coq versions (and no more with older ones). In case compatibility for these newer versions is added, CI should be updated as well to reflect that.

discussion.author: Zimmi48
discussion.comment: Fixed. It is now compatible with Coq 8.8.

discussion.author: Zimmi48
discussion.comment: Closing as I have sent a set of patches for all contribs to Hugo by e-mail.
